content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a function in Julia that does this:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = strip(col)
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
column_name = "   My Column-With_InvalidChars  "
cleaned_name = clean_column(column_name)
println(cleaned_name)  # prints "my_column_with__invalidchars"
```

This function takes a column name as input, lowercases it, removes leading and trailing whitespaces, replaces spaces with underscores, and finally replaces hyphens with underscores. The cleaned column name is then returned.
